lines.text: We both have our old wounds. I have mine here. An old wound, but forever new. A paper stained with blood and tears.
Ahh... his letter? You promised me that you might let me read it.

[Removes Jutaro's letter from inside her kimono and hands it to Komaki]
Here, then... read it.

[Reading aloud Jutaro's letter - the words of which he, Komaki, had actually written]
Farewell, Princess Chiyo, for today I die. Nevermore will my eyes follow my lady's graceful movements. And so memories must suffice. And I recall again your endearing ways. My heart is heavy...

[Voice starting to tremble with emotion, but continues reading]
... for I must die and leave so much of my love unspoken.

[Visibly moved]
The way you read it!

[Recognizing the voice from ten years earlier, in the garden outside her window]
That voice of yours!

[the letter falls from his hands, but he continues reading, since he himself wrote it and knows the words]
Waking and sleeping, my thoughts were ever with you. And though I end this mortal life, my love will never change.
Ohh... you know the letter by heart!
caught and killed in a trap set for me. So ends the life of a clown.
